patterns.description: Directory listing exposed via web indexing
patterns.notes: Indicates web server misconfiguration allowing directory traversal

patterns.pattern: site:{target} filetype:bak OR filetype:backup OR filetype:old
patterns.description: Backup files left accessible on web server
patterns.notes: Often contains credentials or sensitive source code

patterns.description: Configuration files exposed in web root
patterns.notes: May contain database credentials, API keys, secret keys

patterns.pattern: site:{target} inurl:/admin OR inurl:/administrator OR inurl:/wp-admin
patterns.description: Administrative interfaces discoverable via search engines
patterns.notes: Should be behind authentication; discoverable admin panel suggests weak security

patterns.description: Debug information disclosed in error messages
patterns.notes: Reveals internal application structure and potential vulnerabilities

patterns.description: Hardcoded credentials or API keys visible in web pages
patterns.notes: Should never be committed to web-accessible directories

patterns.description: Service version information disclosed in HTTP headers or HTML
patterns.notes: Useful for targeting known vulnerabilities (requires follow-up testing)
